document.masterDocTitle: Taxonomic study of the genus Fujimacia Marumo, 1939 (Lepidoptera: Pyralidae) in China, with descriptions of four new species

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Taxonomic study of the genus Fujimacia Marumo, 1939 (Lepidoptera: Pyralidae) in China, with descriptions of four new species

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Endotricha bicoloralis
Leech, 1889: 65
. Type locality: North Korea .

Pyralis dulciculalis
Swinhoe, 1889: 418
. Type locality: India .

Tegulifera sinensis aestivalis
Caradja, 1925: 320
;
Caradja & Meyrick 1933: 150
;
Hua 2005: 77
.

Diagnosis . Adult ( Fig. 1 ) with wingspan 19.5–22.0 mm.
Fujimacia bicoloralis
is characterized by the entire reddish brown hindwing mixed with fuscous scales, the basolateral process of uncus slender and finger-shaped, and the distal process of gnathos nearly rounded in the male genitalia. It mostly resembles
F . dayaoensis
sp. nov.
superficially, and the differences between them are stated in the diagnosis of
F . dayaoensis
sp. nov.

Remarks. This species was defined in the publication of Leraut (2009) who figured the genitalia morphology of
F . bicoloralis ( Leech, 1889 )
and synonymized
Tegulifera sinensis Caradja, 1925
with
F . bicoloralis
. We refer to the genitalia characters and illustrations presented in Leraut (2009) while diagnosing and delimiting
Fujimacia bicoloralis ( Leech, 1889 )
.
